metadata.Name: Maknuune
metadata.Description: A large open lexicon for Palestinian Arabic (PAL) with over 36K entries, 17K lemmas, and 3.7K roots. Includes diacritized orthography, phonological transcription, English glosses, and optional MSA glosses, examples, phrases, and notes. Focuses on West Bank sub-dialects.
Provider: University College of Educational Sciences - UNRWA
metadata.Paper Title: Maknuune: A Large Open Palestinian Arabic Lexicon
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2022 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
metadata.Venue Name: Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing
Affiliations: University College of Educational Sciences - UNRWA
metadata.Abstract: We present Maknuune <مكنونة>, a large open lexicon for the Palestinian Arabic dialect. Maknuune has over 36K entries from 17K lemmas, and 3.7K roots. All entries include diacritized Arabic orthography, phonological transcription and English glosses. Some entries are enriched with additional information such as broken plurals and templatic feminine forms, associated phrases and collocations, Standard Arabic glosses, and examples or notes on grammar, usage, or location of collected entry.
